Olympic memories will Rio stage a city
of sharp contrasts and emotional
intensity simul and Romero the New York
Times bureau chief in Rio takes the
pulse of the city its people and its
games of all the cities to host the
Olympics Rio's guide to rank among the
most thrilling glimpses of the city's
magnificence in some of the pageantry of
the games come into focus you're
standing in the middle of the Estadio
olímpico home to the track and field
events where Usain Bolt will try once
again to thrill the crowd look around
and it's easy to see why Rio was once
the seed of the Empire of Brazil soaring
granite peaks sunkist beaches the
teeming streets around its pork and
boulevards lined with Belle Epoque
buildings of course Rio also features
the inequality that stains Brazil's
unruly democracy dissent flourishes here
too as Brazil faces bribery scandals and
political upheaval not everyone really
agrees that hosting the games is a good
idea
authorities have spent billions ripping
apart and rebuilding swathes of the city
in their huge overhaul some projects
won't be done until almost the last
